an5.34:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an5.34:4.2: Then General Sīha went up to the Buddha,
an5.34:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
an5.34:4.5: “Sir, can you point out a fruit of giving visible in this very life?”
an5.34:5.2: “A giver, a donor is loved and liked by many people.
an5.34:5.3: This is a fruit of giving, visible in this very life.
an5.34:6.1: Furthermore, good people associate with a giver.
an5.34:6.2: This is another fruit of giving, visible in this very life.
an5.34:7.1: Furthermore, a giver gains a good reputation.
an5.34:7.2: This is another fruit of giving, visible in this very life.
an5.34:8.1: Furthermore, a giver enters any kind of assembly bold and assured,
an5.34:8.2: whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
an5.34:8.6: This is another fruit of giving, visible in this very life.
an5.34:9.1: Furthermore, when a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an5.34:9.2: This is fruit of giving to do with lives to come.”
an5.34:10.1: When he said this, General Sīha said to the Buddha:
an5.34:10.2: “When it comes to those four fruits of giving visible in this very life, I don’t have to rely on faith in the Buddha,
an5.34:10.4: I’m a giver, a donor, and am loved and liked by many people.
an5.34:10.6: and good people associate with me.
an5.34:10.8: and I have this good reputation:
an5.34:10.9: ‘General Sīha gives, serves, and attends on the Saṅgha.’
an5.34:10.10: I’m a giver, and I enter any kind of assembly bold and assured,
an5.34:10.11: whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
an5.34:10.13: When it comes to these four fruits of giving visible in this very life, I don’t have to rely on faith in the Buddha,
an5.34:10.16: ‘When a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ I don’t know this,
an5.34:10.17: so I have to rely on faith in the Buddha.”
an5.34:10.18: “That’s so true, Sīha! That’s so true!
an5.34:10.19: When a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
an5.34:11.1: “Giving, you’re loved and befriended by many people.
an5.34:11.2: You get a good reputation, and your fame grows.
an5.34:11.3: A generous man enters an assembly
an5.34:12.1: So an astute person, seeking happiness, would give gifts,
an5.34:12.2: having driven out the stain of stinginess.
an5.34:12.3: They live long in the threefold heaven,
an5.34:12.4: enjoying the company of the gods.
an5.34:13.1: Having taken the opportunity to do good, when they pass from here
an5.34:13.2: they wander radiant in the Garden of Delight.
an5.34:13.3: There they delight, rejoice, and enjoy themselves,
an5.34:13.4: provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
an5.34:13.5: Doing what the unattached, the poised one says,
an5.34:13.6: disciples of the Holy One rejoice in heaven.”
